text: ਮਾਲੀ ਗਉੜਾ ਬਾਣੀ ਭਗਤ ਨਾਮਦੇਵ ਜੀ ਕੀ
section: Mali Gaura - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Maalee Gauraa, The Word Of Devotee Naam Dayv Jee:

transliteration.text: mālī gaurā bānī bhagat nāmadēv jī kī

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Mali Gaura - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਧਨਿ ਧੰਨਿ ਓ ਰਾਮ ਬੇਨੁ ਬਾਜੈ ॥
section: Mali Gaura - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Blessed, blessed is that flute which the Lord plays.

transliteration.text: dhan dhann ō rām bēn bājai .

melody.description: Mali Gaura conveys the confidence of an expert, whose knowledge is self-evident in both their outlook and actions. This knowledge is learned through experience and therefore creates an air of ‘coolness’. However, this sense of ‘coolness’ is an aspect of true happiness because you have learned how to manage things with expertise and skill.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

text: ਮਧੁਰ ਮਧੁਰ ਧੁਨਿ ਅਨਹਤ ਗਾਜੈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Mali Gaura - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The sweet, sweet unstruck sound current sings forth. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: madhur madhur dhun anahat gājai .1. rahāu .

translation.text: Naam Dayv's Lord and Master plays happily. ||4||1||
